reason: The functionality provided by `EstimateParameters` has been integrated into more general-purpose methods (`Board::matchImagePoints` and `cv::solvePnP`) to improve flexibility and reduce redundancy.
The CV_USRTYPE1 field was deprecated to streamline API usage and point developers to CV_16F as a better alternative.

Inference Engine internal backend API runtime parameter OPENCV_DNN_BACKEND_INFERENCE_ENGINE_TYPE was made unused since version 4.6.0. Maintainers moved away from using it to simplify internal operations and promote other backend options.
This method allocates a layer and computes outputs but has been deprecated and marked for removal in a future release to improve the API's usability and to streamline functionality.
The API was deprecated in favor of using `Mat::convertTo` with a more appropriate and scalable implementation.

The method `getLayer(java.lang.String layerName)` using a string argument to retrieve a layer by its name was replaced with `getLayerId(String layer)` for better performance and to standardize the API to use integer-based identifiers.
End users are advised to use Facemark::getFaces for more manual and customizable face detection, circumventing the hard-coded approach in getFacesHAAR.

The constructors for BFMatcher were deprecated in favor of factory methods to streamline the API design and enforce better usage practices. Factory methods like `BFMatcher.create()` are preferred for initialization because they provide a flexible and consistent interface.
Original code license conflict. The implementation was removed but restored after the publication of the 'Computation of a NFA' code under the MIT license.

The `setLegacyPattern` method introduced legacy chessboard patterns for compatibility with patterns created in OpenCV versions prior to 4.6.0. It addresses the issue discussed in https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/23152.
Incompatible change in ChArUco pattern generation algorithm for even row counts after OpenCV 4.6.0.
This method was deprecated in favor of the `loadOCRHMMClassifier` due to improved functionality and support for additional classifier types.
The TextDetector class was deprecated in favor of TextDetectorCNN, which offers better performance and enhanced capabilities for text detection tasks.
The Converters class consolidates methods for converting between Mat and Java collection types efficiently. No alternative API is mentioned in the documentation.
DeepFlow offers better optical flow quality but is slower, aligning with use cases prioritizing accuracy over speed.
No explicit reason provided in the documentation, but likely superseded or streamlined for usage with newer OpenCV APIs.
